posts.post_content:
It feels like our Beguiler was made to synergize with [Call to the Kindred](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call to the Kindred) in a human tribal deck.  
  
Put the enchantment onto [Invisible Stalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Invisible Stalker) and begin to amass a large number of humans.   
  
Combine those with said stalker, [Azure Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azure Mage), [AEther Adept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=AEther Adept), and [Delver of Secrets](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Delver of Secrets), and you could have a small army powering the Beguiler of Wills ability. The Delver is powerful, the adept bounces everything. Could be a fun combo. Not going to get to the standard meta, but for casual it could be annoyingly fun.
posts.html:
It feels like our Beguiler was made to synergize with Call to the Kindred in a human tribal deck.

Put the enchantment onto Invisible Stalker and begin to amass a large number of humans.

Combine those with said stalker, Azure Mage, AEther Adept, and Delver of Secrets, and you could have a small army powering the Beguiler of Wills ability. The Delver is powerful, the adept bounces everything. Could be a fun combo. Not going to get to the standard meta, but for casual it could be annoyingly fun.

Posted By: Kryptnyt (1/26/2012 4:36:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Interestingly, she works well in a [Talrand, Sky Summoner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Talrand, Sky Summoner) EDH deck.   
  
You'll have a bunch of 2/2 flying tokens lying around by just playing [Gitaxian Probe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gitaxian Probe) for free (if that's your cup of tea), so why not have a continuous, no-extra-paperwork (as in, your opponent can get a [Mind Control](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Control)'ed creature back by destroying [Mind Control](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Control)). Even if she dies (and she'll die a lot), you still keep it.   
  
The only, ONLY problem is the high cost versus toughness. A 1/2 or 1/3 would've been really great.
posts.html:

Even if she dies (and she'll die a lot), you still keep it.

The only, ONLY problem is the high cost versus toughness. A 1/2 or 1/3 would've been really great.

Posted By: BorosFan (1/29/2013 7:22:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Works best alongside cards like Snakeform, Ovinize, and Serendib Sorceror, which make it so that you don't need to control a multitude of creatures just to capture one decently powered one. The problem with the multi-creature method is that you're just asking for someone to drop a sweeper and gain massive card advantage. At least something like Snakeform or Sorceror are half decent on their own as pseudo-removal, as well as helping your repeatable Mind Control.  
  
@Zinliah: Turn to Frog or any of the other 1/x spells like Diminish aren't a \*guarantee\*. It's close to a guarantee, but if they kill the Beguiler in response and she's the only creature that player controlled, when her ability resolves the creature's power (1) will be more than the number of creature's the ability's controller controls (0), so it'll be countered as its target will be illegal. Serendib Sorceror is as close to a guarantee as you're going to get, and even that's not a guarantee due to pumps like Giant Growth or E... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Works best alongside cards like Snakeform, Ovinize, and Serendib Sorceror, which make it so that you don't need to control a multitude of creatures just to capture one decently powered one. The problem with the multi-creature method is that you're just asking for someone to drop a sweeper and gain massive card advantage. At least something like Snakeform or Sorceror are half decent on their own as pseudo-removal, as well as helping your repeatable Mind Control.

@Zinliah: Turn to Frog or any of the other 1/x spells like Diminish aren't a *guarantee*. It's close to a guarantee, but if they kill the Beguiler in response and she's the only creature that player controlled, when her ability resolves the creature's power (1) will be more than the number of creature's the ability's controller controls (0), so it'll be countered as its target will be illegal. Serendib Sorceror is as close to a guarantee as you're going to get, and even that's not a guarantee due to pumps like Giant Growth or E... (see all)

You'll have a bunch of 2/2 flying tokens lying around by just playing [Gitaxian Probe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gitaxian Probe) for free (if that's your cup of tea), so why not have a continuous, no-extra-paperwork (as in, your opponent can get a [Mind Control](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Control)'ed creature back by destroying [Mind Control](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Control)). The only, ONLY problem is the high cost versus toughness. A 1/2 or 1/3 would've been really great.
